Events that occurred on 12 July.

content.title: On Earth
content.content:
1918 - J.R.R. Tolkien is readmitted to Brooklands Officers' Hospital, Kingston-upon-Hull by this date.
1940 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes Letter 38a.
1967 - J.R.R. Tolkien starts writing letter 295b.
1973 - J.R.R. Tolkien is awarded an honorary Doctorate of Letters by the University of Edinburgh.
1979 - Mythcon 10 in San Jose, California.
1981 - The nineteenth episode of the 1981 radio series of The Lord of the Rings is aired on BBC Radio 4.
2002 - Przemyslaw Mroczkowski, scholar and friend of J.R.R. Tolkien, dies.
2005 - Der Berggeist is auctioned at Sotheby's.
2005 - Tolkien Thing VII in Hohensolms, Hohenahr, Germany.
2008 - Tolkien Thing X in Rieneck, Germany.
2013 - Mythcon 44 at Michigan State University, East Lansing.

content.title: In Arda
content.content:
T.A. 1944:
The Disaster of the Morannon.
Death of Ondoher, King of Gondor, and his sons Artamir and Faramir.
T.A. 3018:
Gandalf is held captive by Saruman on the pinnacle of Orthanc.
Boromir travels towards Rivendell to ask for counsel.
